goal.text: Touch a Bench on a scenic setpiece
goal.tooltip: Either the one on the grasslands temple or one of the three on the beach's amphitheater (with a glass spear on top), but not the one in front of the Manta shop (Rupee Bottle and Snorkel)
You may use them as payment after achievement of this goal.
A Ring of Risk from the Forest fountain or a Ring of Blasting from the Cliffs fountain
You will need 3 gears and to talk to the Gerudo inside the ruins, as well as extend the bridge in Death Mountain.

goal.text: Get a dungeon map or compass in each instrument dungeon
goal.tooltip: You only need one or the other in each dungeon: Frozen Grotto, Gerudo Ruins, Temple of Storms, and Lost Swamp.

goal.text: Compass and Map in Frozen Grotto
Compass and Map in Gerudo Ruins
Compass and Map in Temple of Storms
Compass and Map in Lost Swamp

goal.tooltip: Buy all four Heart Pieces in Freddie's shops in the instrument dungeons. There's always one in each instrument dungeon's 1F.

goal.text: All Heart Pieces on instrument dungeon tiles
goal.tooltip: Collect all 3 heart pieces in the 3 large-area Overworld portions outside of instrument dungeons: Gerudo Desert (outside Gerudo Ruins), Lake Hylia (outside Frozen Grotto), and Death Mountain (outside Temple of Storms).
Three of Cave / Treasure / Skull / Warp Charm and Telescope
Four of Cave / Treasure / Skull / Warp Charm and Telescope
WARNING: The 4th gear has a low% chance of not spawning in some seeds.

These are typically indicated by the staircases being dark, bleeding darkness to the tiles around it; inside looks similar to Kakariko Crypt, except linear in layout. WARNING: While at least 2 existing in a seed is highly likely, it's possible that there might be only 1.
Puzzle caves are the ones with round entrances. One always appears by Zelda's tower, and one always appears by Link's house.
You do not need to open the chest once you clear the screen.

goal.text: Defeat Bass Guitarmos Knights as Link

goal.tooltip: You do not need to grab the keys if you don't want to.

goal.text: Purple Chest on the Gauntlet Tile
goal.tooltip: Open the purple chest on the two-tile wide Gauntlet Overworld tile. This usually involves a puzzle of sorts to reach. The particular screen is NOT the Hyrule Castle Bridge tile.
The map must show an 'X' on both staircase icons of Hyrule Brdige's map tiles.
The map must show an 'X' on all 3 staircase icons of Death Mountain's map tiles (the one beneath ToS, and the two in the center tiles of DM above Windmill Hut.
Pay the Potion Shopkeep to have your fortune told. You can only have one Fortune told at a time, so you must clear the first one before you can pay for a second.

Use Ice Rod OR Fire Rod OR Can of Somaria OR (Magic) Boomerang while facing the dog in Kakariko (this is not an in-game-recognized interaction; it's just a way to incorporate the Kakariko dog into the bingo that isn't just "Pet the dog").
Bombs, Bombchus, Din's Fire, and Bomb Fairies are all banned.
Bombs, Bombchus, Din's Fire, and Bomb Fairies are all banned.

goal.text: Defeat Gleeokenspiel after killing every Gleeokenspiel Head

goal.tooltip: Use ONLY a permanent (non-glass) weapon and your L/R abilities to kill Gleeokenspiel.

goal.text: Defeat Bass Guitarmos Knights as Link
Defeat Bass Guitarmos Knights as Cadence
Defeat Bass Guitarmos Knights using base dagger / shortsword
goal.tooltip: Items and skills are allowed.

goal.text: Defeat Gohmaracas using base dagger / shortsword
goal.tooltip: Items and skills are allowed.

goal.text: Defeat Gohmaracas after breaking every bush in the arena
Defeat Gohmaracas using ONLY non-explosive A/X/B/Y items
goal.tooltip: Weapons, L/R abilities, bomb(chu)s, and bomb fairies are not allowed to hurt Gohmaracas (equip a dagger to minimize accidental pokes; you may use forbidden weapons against small gohmas)
Use ONLY a permanent (non-glass) weapon and your L/R abilities to kill Gohmaracas.
All of Cave / Treasure / Skull / Warp Charm and Telescope
You do not have to visit every tile, but the entire map must be visible.
You do not need to grab the keys if you don't want to.

goal.text: Fight All 3 Hyrule Castle Key Arenas
goal.tooltip: You do not need to grab the keys if you don't want to.

goal.text: Defeat Wizroboe using ONLY non-explosive A/B/X/Y items
goal.tooltip: Weapons, L/R abilities, bomb(chu)s, and bomb fairies are not allowed to hurt Wizroboe (equip a dagger to minimize accidental pokes; you may use forbidden weapons against wizrobes & snowflakes)
Use ONLY a permanent (non-glass) weapon and your L/R abilities to defeat Wizroboe.

goal.text: Defeat Bass Guitarmos without using explosives
goal.tooltip: Bombs, Bombchus, Din's Fire, and Bomb Fairies are all banned.
Use ONLY a permanent (non-glass) weapon and your L/R abilities to defeat Bass Guitarmos.
You can go to Zelda's room for a map peek, but you must still start as Link.
The special daggers / shortswords can still be used.
You can still get the lute from I AM ERROR or in the castle infusion room. You can enter the caves, but if you pick up the key item, you lose this square.

goal.text: Don't open any purple dungeon chests

goal.tooltip: You can pick up bombs, but you cannot use them. Bombchus and Din's Fire are allowed.
The diamond coupon can still be used.
You can still steal and use coupons. If your rupee count ever decreases you lose this square.

goal.text: Don't pick up any heart containers
goal.tooltip: Heart pieces are allowed.

goal.text: Skip Nayru's Love in Hyrule Castle
goal.tooltip: You can still pick up the shield (which includes Nayru's Love) at Link's house.
Don't pick up Nayru's Love OR Link's Shield.

goal.text: Skip Nayru's Love in Hyrule Castle
goal.tooltip: 1F skips and boss key skips are banned. For each dungeon floor, you must enter through the entrance, kill the miniboss, and exit through the exit. Gear skip is also banned.
Do not use wall adventure around Hyrule Castle. This does not forbid the HC infusion (swimming) or other forms of wall adventures, or starting as Zelda.
This includes glass weapons, glass shovel, glass slippers, glass torch, AND glass ring

goal.text: All Four Future Hyrule Legendary Weapons
goal.tooltip: Hylian Flail, Fragarach, Impa's Nagintana, and Jeweled Dagger / Kokiri Sword are required. The other legendary weapons are not required.
Royal Rapier, Caladbolg, and Eli's Greatshovel are all required. The other legendary weapons are not required.

goal.text: One Permanent Weapon of Each Type
goal.tooltip: Glass weapons do not count, but legendary weapons do. You must have a shortsword, dagger, broadsword, spear, flail, longsword, rapier, and greatshovel.
All permenent items and their respective upgrades, including L/R skills. Passive items and capacity upgrades are not required.
